item.title: 澳大利亚第二季度工资增速为一年来最慢
item.description: 澳大利亚 6 月份工资增长速度为一年来最慢，低于预期，而私营部门的增长放缓表明劳动力市场正在放缓。【原文：Australian wages rose at their slowest pace in a year in the June quarter, falling short of expectations, while softer gains in the private sector suggest the labour market was easing.】

item.title: 日本股市在美国数据大爆炸前提振亚洲股市
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市上涨，日本股市因日元走稳而领涨，交易商正在等待包括美国通胀报告在内的数据，以判断美联储在上周动荡后的政策前景。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Tuesday, led by Japanese shares on the back of a steady yen, with traders awaiting data including the U.S. inflation report to gauge the Federal Reserve's policy outlook after volatile moves last week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第二季度工资增速为一年来最慢
item.description: 澳大利亚 6 月份工资增长速度为一年来最慢，这表明本轮经济周期的顶峰已经过去，仅凭工资增长并不能阻止降息。【原文：Australian wages rose at their slowest pace in a year in the June quarter, confirming the peak for this cycle had passed and wages alone would not be a bar to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 7 月商业形势反弹，成本压力缓解
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于就业率回升，澳大利亚 7 月份的商业状况有所改善，而由于高利率导致需求放缓，成本压力继续减轻。【原文：Australian business conditions improved in July due to a rebound in employment, a survey showed on Tuesday, while cost pressures continued to ease as high interest rates worked to slow demand.】

item.title: 市场重新关注需求忧虑，油价有所回落
item.description: 石油价格周二走低，打破了连续五天的涨势，原因是欧佩克周一下调了对2024年需求增长的预期，而中国的预期又有所放缓，因此市场重新关注对需求的担忧。【原文：Oil prices edged lower on Tuesday, breaking a five-day streak of gains, as markets refocused on concerns about demand after OPEC on Monday cut its forecast for demand growth in 2024 due to softer expectations in China.】

item.title: 美元绷紧神经，等待数据对降息风险的定论
item.description: 美元在周二陷入了困境，因为投资者在观望美国经济数据对大幅降息的影响，而日本股市的反弹则帮助抑制了日元套利交易的出血。【原文：The dollar was in limbo on Tuesday as investors waited to see how U.S. economic data affected the chance of outsized rate cuts, while a rally in Japanese stocks helped staunch the bleeding in yen carry trades.】

item.title: 澳大利亚消费者对加息的担忧有所缓解，减税政策也已启动
item.description: 周二的一项调查显示，由于政府减税和其他生活成本措施的实施，澳大利亚消费者对利率的担忧有所缓解，家庭经济前景也有所改善，澳大利亚消费者情绪在8月份出现反弹。【原文：Australian consumer sentiment bounced in August as rate fears subsided and the outlook for family finances improved due to the government's tax cuts and other cost-of-living measures, a survey showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 新加坡第二季度国内生产总值同比增长 2.9%，与预估值持平
item.description: 新加坡政府周二公布的数据显示，4-6 月份新加坡经济同比增长 2.9%，与官方预估值持平，高于市场预期。【原文：Singapore's economy grew 2.9% in the April-June quarter from a year earlier, matching the official advance estimate and above market expectations, government data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 备忘录称花旗集团市场部门数字资产主管离职
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份内部备忘录，花旗集团市场部门数字资产主管 Shobhit Maini 将在离职 14 年后离开该行。【原文：Citigroup's head of digital assets for its markets unit, Shobhit Maini, is leaving the bank after more than 14 years, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.】

item.title: Rho Motion称，7月份全球电动汽车销量增长21%，中国创下2024年最大增幅
item.description: 市场研究公司 Rho Motion 周一表示，尽管欧洲需求下降，但得益于中国今年最强劲的增长势头，7 月份全球全电动汽车和插电式混合动力汽车的销量同比增长了 21%。【原文：Global sales of fully electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles rose by a yearly 21% in July, thanks to China's strongest growth this year and despite dropping demand in Europe, market research firm Rho Motion said Monday.】

item.title: 精神航空首席执行官沙纳汉将获得 2850 万美元的 "金降落伞
item.description: 根据周一提交的一份监管文件，在这家 737 MAX 机身供应商完成与波音公司的合并后，精神航空系统公司首席执行官帕特里克-沙纳汉（Patrick Shanahan）将获得 2850 万美元的报酬。【原文：Spirit AeroSystems CEO Patrick Shanahan will receive a payout of $28.5 million after the 737 MAX fuselage supplier completes its merger with Boeing , according to a regulatory filing on Monday.】

item.title: 亚洲 新发现的市场平静等待动荡考验
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 埃克森裁员 59 人，收购先锋公司后开始裁员
item.description: 根据向德克萨斯州劳动力委员会提交的文件，埃克森美孚将裁员 59 人，其中二叠纪盆地 10 人，达拉斯 39 人。【原文：Exxon Mobil is laying off 59 employees, including 10 in the Permian Basin and 39 in Dallas, according to a filing with the Texas Workforce Commission.】

item.title: J&J公司获得索赔人足够支持，达成65亿美元的滑石粉和解协议 - 彭博社
item.description: 据彭博社报道，强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）拟以 65 亿美元的价格解决数万起指控其婴儿爽身粉和其他滑石粉产品致癌的诉讼案，该提议已迈过了获得支持的关键门槛。【原文：Johnson & Johnson has cleared a key threshold of support for its proposed $6.5 billion settlement of tens of thousands of lawsuits alleging its baby powder and other talc products caused cancer, according to a Bloomberg report.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行前首席财务官以性别陈规定型观念为由起诉加拿大银行不当解聘
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行前首席财务官纳丁-安（Nadine Ahn）对该银行提起了不当解雇诉讼，并声称 "基于性别的刻板印象 "是她被解雇的原因之一。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada's former CFO Nadine Ahn has filed a wrongful-termination lawsuit against the bank, and alleged that "gender-based stereotyping" was at play in her dismissal.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会起诉涉嫌 6.5 亿美元的全球加密货币欺诈案
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission）周一起诉了加密货币公司 NovaTech 及其已婚联合创始人，称他们以欺诈手段从全球 20 多万名投资者那里筹集了超过 6.5 亿美元，其中包括许多海地裔美国人。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday sued the cryptocurrency company NovaTech and its married co-founders, saying they fraudulently raised over $650 million from more than 200,000 investors worldwide, including many Haitian-Americans.】

item.title: 美国 7 月联邦赤字增长
item.description: 美国财政部周一表示，美国政府 7 月份录得 2,440 亿美元的预算赤字，比去年同期增长 10%，但考虑到日历差异，赤字缺口本应缩小 450 亿美元。【原文：The U.S. government recorded a $244 billion budget deficit for July, up 10% from a year earlier, but accounting for calendar differences, the gap would have been $45 billion narrower, the Treasury Department said on Monday.】

item.title: 三藩市联储报告称，现金垫缩水或将抑制美国消费者支出
item.description: 目前，美国中低收入家庭拥有的银行存款等流动性资源远远少于 COVID-19 大流行病爆发前的水平，这造成了资金紧张，给作为经济支柱的消费支出带来了风险。【原文：Middle- and low-income U.S. families now have significantly fewer liquid resources like bank deposits than they were on track to have before the disruptions of the COVID-19 pandemic, creating financial strains that pose a risk to consumer spending, the backbone of the economy.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西航空工业公司有望获得维珍澳大利亚公司的 E190-E2 喷射机订单
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）在与欧洲空中客车公司（Airbus）最小机型 A220 的竞争中胜出，将获得维珍澳大利亚公司（Virgin Australia）8 架 E190-E2 支线喷气机的订单。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer is set to secure an order for eight E190-E2 regional jets from Virgin Australia after winning a competition against the A220, the smallest model of Europe's Airbus , industry sources said on Monday.】

item.title: 轮胎制造商固特异将投资 5.75 亿加元升级加拿大工厂
item.description: 安大略省政府周一表示，固特异轮胎橡胶公司（Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co）加拿大分公司将投资超过 5.75 亿加元（约合 4.184 亿美元）对其位于安大略省纳帕尼（Napanee）的工厂进行升级改造。【原文：The Canadian unit of Goodyear Tire & Rubber Co will invest over C$575 million ($418.4 million) to upgrade its plant in Napanee, Ontario, the provincial government said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国公用事业公司有望在下半年掀起数据中心需求浪潮
item.description: 美国电力公司在第二季度达成了几项供应交易，加强了市场对全年销售增长的预期，从而看好为人工智能繁荣提供动力的数据中心的需求。【原文：U.S. electric utilities sounded bullish on demand from data centers powering the artificial intelligence boom after striking several supply deals during the second quarter, reinforcing market expectations of sales growth through the year.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国政府结束了对浑水公司卡森-布洛克的调查
item.description: 据两位熟悉此事的消息人士透露，美国当局已告知卡森-布洛克，他们已结束对该做空者活动的民事和刑事调查，但未采取任何行动。【原文：U.S. authorities have told Carson Block that they have ended their civil and criminal investigations into the short seller’s activities without taking any action, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国消费者中期通胀预期下降
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行周一发布的一份报告显示，7月份美国消费者的中期通胀预期大幅放缓，尽管他们对近期和长期物价压力的预期保持稳定，但家庭对偿还债务的担忧与日俱增。【原文：U.S. consumers' medium-term inflation expectations eased substantially in July even as their near- and longer-term outlooks for price pressures held steady, although households are increasingly worried about staying current on their debt, a Federal Reserve Bank of New York report showed on Monday.】

item.title: 谷歌称将停用基于俄罗斯的 AdSense 账户
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌周一表示，将停用在俄罗斯的 AdSense 账户，无法再向该国的广告服务用户付款。【原文：Alphabet's Google is deactivating AdSense accounts in Russia, saying on Monday that it would no longer be able to make payments to users of its advertising service in the country.】

item.title: 投资基金涌入澳大利亚银行；谨慎对待矿商
item.description: 在传统上以矿业为主导的本地主要指数中，澳大利亚金融股占据主导地位，这主要是由于中国需求不佳，股票基金对大宗商品支持行业持谨慎态度，因此对金融股的兴趣与日俱增。【原文：Australian financial stocks are ruling the roost on the traditionally miners-led local main index, fueled by growing interest from equity funds that are wary of the commodity-backed sector due to poor Chinese demand.】

item.title: 保时捷控股集团入股灰狗公司所有者 Flix
item.description: 保时捷汽车控股公司（Porsche Automobil Holding SE）周一表示，它是一个投资集团的一部分，该集团将持有北美灰狗公司（Greyhound）和欧洲 FlixBus 公司（FlixBus）的所有者 Flix SE 35% 的股份。【原文：Porsche Automobil Holding SE said on Monday it is part of an investor group that is taking a 35% stake in Flix SE, owner of Greyhound services in North America and FlixBus in Europe.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，星巴克与 Elliott 正在就和解进行谈判
item.description: 据 CNBC 周一援引消息人士的话报道，星巴克和激进投资者埃利奥特管理公司（Elliott Management）正在商讨和解事宜。【原文：Starbucks and activist investor Elliott Management are talking about a settlement, CNBC reported on Monday, citing sources.】

item.title: 雪佛龙在超高压油田开创行业先河
item.description: 雪佛龙能源公司（Chevron）周一表示，该公司实现了一项技术突破，在极高的海底压力下从美国墨西哥湾的一个油田生产出了第一批石油。【原文：Chevron has achieved a technological breakthrough, producing first oil from a U.S. Gulf of Mexico field under extreme subsea pressures, the energy company said on Monday.】

item.title: 捷蓝航空将通过发债融资逾 30 亿美元，股价下跌
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）周一表示，该公司计划通过单独发债筹集约 31.5 亿美元资金，其中大部分资金由其忠诚度计划 TrueBlue 支持，以努力改善其流动性。【原文：JetBlue Airways said on Monday it plans to raise about $3.15 billion in capital through separate debt offerings, the majority backed by its loyalty program, TrueBlue, as it tries to improve its liquidity.】

item.title: 环球音乐与 Meta 扩大音乐许可协议
item.description: 全球最大的音乐厂牌环球音乐集团（UMG）周一宣布与 Facebook 母公司 Meta Platforms 达成扩大协议，在 Meta 的社交平台上为旗下艺人和词曲作者创造新的机会。【原文：Universal Music Group (UMG), the world's biggest music label, announced on Monday an expanded agreement with Facebook-parent Meta Platforms to create new opportunities for its artists and songwriters across Meta's social platforms.】
